testcase.name: job_processor_helper_tests:0 pretty_print_success_test
job_processor_helper_tests:0 demo_test
testcase.system-out:
============================================================== Job Processor Demo ==============================================================
Processing example job...
============================================================== SUCCESS! ==============================================================
Execution Order: task-1 -> task-3 -> task-2 -> task-4
JSON Response: { "tasks": [ { "command": "touch /tmp/file1", "name": "task-1" }, { "command": "echo 'Hello World!' > /tmp/file1", "name": "task-3" }, { "command": "cat /tmp/file1", "name": "task-2" }, { "command": "rm /tmp/file1", "name": "task-4" } ] }
Bash Script: 1: #!/usr/bin/env bash 2: touch /tmp/file1 3: echo 'Hello World!' > /tmp/file1 4: cat /tmp/file1 5: rm /tmp/file1
Try these commands: job_processor_helper:demo(). job_processor_helper:pretty_print(job_processor:process_job(YourJson)).
